heading: hp's all-in-one music box
subheading: hewlett-packard releases a cd burner that simplifies copying all kinds of digital music, and includes safeguards to protect copyrights. by andy patrizio.
author: andy patrizio
text: hewlett-packard is looking to simplify music recording while addressing copyright concerns with the release of the hp cd-writer music, a recordable drive designed specifically for creating music cds. most of the cd-writer music functions, such as creating a music cd from mp3 files or copying tracks from a music cd, can be done with a cd-r or cd-rw drive. but they can be annoying processes requiring multiple steps.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
